Key Arguments: The proposed legislation would limit freedom of speech.
Existing laws and restrictions during the Covid-19 pandemic were ineffective and overly restrictive.
Social media platforms' fact-checkers are biased and enforce government narratives.
There is a risk of corruption and influence from big businesses, particularly pharmaceutical companies.
Australia already has laws to protect against hate speech and threats, making new powers unnecessary.
Notable Quotes: I totally oppose the proposed new powers, or any power that would limit freedom of speech.
The so called ‘fact checkers’ at the social media platforms were proven not to check facts during the Covid pandemic, but to instead just enforce the opinion of their masters.
Australia already has laws in place to protect people from hate speech or threats, so we do not need to introduce these new powers.
